summary: "Road to Perdition" is a 2002 crime drama film directed by Sam Mendes. Based on a graphic novel, it stars Tom Hanks and Paul Newman. Set in 1931, the story follows a mobster and his son seeking revenge after a mobster kills their family. The film explores themes like family and violence. It was a box office hit and received critical acclaim, earning several Academy Award nominations, including for Newman's performance and winning for Best Cinematography.
title: Road to Perdition
